questions.question: What is the empirical formula of the compound synthesized from Cs[closo-1-H-CB11Me11] and AgNO3?
What method was used for the crystallographic measurements of the synthesized compounds?
questions.answer: Nonius KappaCCD diffractometer with Mo Κα radiation

questions.question: How does the addition of [NBu4][closo-1-H-CB11H5Br6] to a CD2Cl2 solution of (PPh3)Ag[closo-1-H-CB11Me11] affect the NMR spectrum?
questions.answer: It results in the formation of (PPh3)Ag(closo-1-H-CB11H5Br6) and [NBu4][closo-1-H-CB11Me11], with the cage methyl region in the 1H{11B} NMR spectrum being sharp, upfield shifted, and essentially identical to pure [NBu4][closo-1-H-CB11Me11].

questions.question: What is the effect of adding a stronger Lewis base than [closo-1-H-CB11Me11]- on the Ag···H3C interactions in solution?
questions.answer: The addition of a stronger Lewis base than [closo-1-H-CB11Me11]- switches off the Ag···H3C interactions in solution.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of NMe4[closo-CB11Me12] involves exhaustive methylation of NMe4[closo-1-Me-CB11H11] using methyl triflate and a hindered base.
True or False: The solid-state structure of compound 1 shows close intermolecular Ag···H3C contacts.
What is the role of the 3,5-Me2 groups in the phenyl rings of the phosphine ligand in the synthesis of (P(3,5-Me2-C6H3)3)Ag[closo-1-H-CB11Me11]?
questions.answer: The 3,5-Me2 groups in the phenyl rings of the phosphine ligand discourage the close approach of more than one large carborane anion with the silver(I) center, thus restricting the Ag···carborane interactions to a single cage.

questions.question: True or False: The addition of diethyl ether to (PPh3)Ag[closo-1-H-CB11Me11] results in the formation of a complex where Ag···H3C interactions are still present in solution.
What computational method was used for the DFT calculations on the permethylated [closo-CB11Me12]- anion and its complexes?
questions.answer: B3LYP hybrid method with the DZVP basis sets

questions.question: True or False: The addition of PPh3 to (PPh3)Ag[closo-1-H-CB11Me11] immediately forms [(PPh3)2Ag][closo-1-H-CB11Me11].
